DOC.brief_summary: This is an study to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and tolerability of RGH-188 relative to placebo in adult patients (18-60 years of age) with acute exacerbation of schizophrenia.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of RGH-188 in the Acute Exacerbation of Schizophrenia
DOC.criteria: Male or female 18 to 60 years of age meeting DSMIV criteria for schizophrenia (paranoid type, disorganized type, catatonic type or undifferentiated type) based on the SCID having a total PANSS score greater than or equal to 80 and less than or equal to 120 Patients with a schizophrenia diagnosis for a minimum of 1 year. Patients who exhibit abnormalities on Physical Examination, have abnormal vital signs, ECG, or clinical laboratory values. Patients experiencing first episode of psychosis.
